verses.verse: A Song <WH7892> or Psalm <WH4210> for the sons <WH1121> of Korach <WH7141>, to the chief Musician <WH5329> <WH8764> upon Mahalath <WH4257> Leannoth <WH6031> <WH8763>, Maschil <WH4905> <WH8688> of Heman <WH1968> the Ezrahite <WH250>. O YY <WH3068> 'Elohim <WH430> of my salvation <WH3444>, I have cried <WH6817> <WH8804> day <WH3117> and night <WH3915> before thee:
Let my prayer <WH8605> come <WH935> <WH8799> before <WH6440> thee: incline <WH5186> <WH8685> thine ear <WH241> unto my cry <WH7440>;
For my soul <WH5315> is full <WH7646> <WH8804> of troubles <WH7451>: and my life <WH2416> draweth nigh <WH5060> <WH8689> unto the grave <WH7585>.
I am counted <WH2803> <WH8738> with them that go down <WH3381> <WH8802> into the pit <WH953>: I am as a man <WH1397> that hath no strength <WH353>:

Free <WH2670> among the dead <WH4191> <WH8801>, like the slain <WH2491> that lie <WH7901> <WH8802> in the grave <WH6913>, whom thou rememberest <WH2142> <WH8804> no more: and they are cut off <WH1504> <WH8738> from thy hand <WH3027>.
Thou hast laid <WH7896> <WH8804> me in the lowest <WH8482> pit <WH953>, in darkness <WH4285>, in the deeps <WH4688>.
Thy wrath <WH2534> lieth hard <WH5564> <WH8804> upon me, and thou hast afflicted <WH6031> <WH8765> me with all thy waves <WH4867>. Selah <WH5542>.

Thou hast put away <WH7368> mine acquaintance <WH3045> <WH8794> far <WH7368> <WH8689> from me; thou hast made <WH7896> <WH8804> me an abomination <WH8441> unto them: I am shut up <WH3607> <WH8803>, and I cannot come forth <WH3318> <WH8799>.

Mine eye <WH5869> mourneth <WH1669> <WH8804> by reason of affliction <WH6040>: YY <WH3068>, I have called <WH7121> <WH8804> daily <WH3117> upon thee, I have stretched out <WH7849> <WH8765> my hands <WH3709> unto thee.
Wilt thou shew <WH6213> <WH8799> wonders <WH6382> to the dead <WH4191> <WH8801>? shall the dead <WH7496> arise <WH6965> <WH8799> and praise <WH3034> <WH8686> thee? Selah <WH5542>.
Shall thy lovingkindness <WH2617> be declared <WH5608> <WH8792> in the grave <WH6913>? or thy faithfulness <WH530> in destruction <WH11> ?
Shall thy wonders <WH6382> be known <WH3045> <WH8735> in the dark <WH2822>? and thy righteousness <WH6666> in the land <WH776> of forgetfulness <WH5388> ?
But unto thee have I cried <WH7768> <WH8765>, O YY <WH3068>; and in the morning <WH1242> shall my prayer <WH8605> prevent <WH6923> <WH8762> thee.
YY <WH3068>, why castest thou off <WH2186> <WH8799> my soul <WH5315>? why hidest <WH5641> <WH8686> thou thy face <WH6440> from me?
I am afflicted <WH6041> and ready to die <WH1478> <WH8802> from my youth <WH5290> up: while I suffer <WH5375> <WH8804> thy terrors <WH367> I am distracted <WH6323> <WH8799>.
Thy fierce wrath <WH2740> goeth over <WH5674> <WH8804> me; thy terrors <WH1161> have cut me off <WH6789> <WH8768>.
They came round about <WH5437> <WH8804> me daily <WH3117> like water <WH4325>; they compassed <WH5362> <WH8689> me about together <WH3162>.
Lover <WH157> <WH8802> and friend <WH7453> hast thou put far <WH7368> <WH8689> from me, and mine acquaintance <WH3045> <WH8794> into darkness <WH4285>.
